feed.title: AI Code Guidebook - game
feed.subtitle: A comprehensive guide to AI-powered code development

entry.title: Game Terminology
entry.content:
Core Game Concepts:

  1. Entity: A fundamental game object.
  2. Component: A data structure that defines an entity’s attributes.
  3. System: A process that operates on entities and components.
  4. World: The overall game environment.
  5. Scene: A specific area or level within the world.
  6. GameState: The overall state of the game.
  7. Player: The controlled character.
  8. Actor: A general term for any entity that can act.
  9. Object: A general game element.
  10. Item: A collectible or usable object.
  11. Inventory: A collection of items.
  12. Equipment: Items worn or used by an actor.
  13. Skill: A learned ability.
  14. Spell: A magical ability.
  15. Effect: A temporary change to an entity’s state.
  16. Status: A persistent change to an entity’s state.
  17. Buff: A positive status effect.
  18. Debuff: A negative status effect.
  19. Projectile: A launched object.
  20. Trigger: An event that initiates an action.
  21. Interaction: An action between entities.
  22. Dialogue: A conversation between characters.
  23. Quest: A task given to the player.
  24. Objective: A specific goal within a quest.
  25. Loot: Items dropped by defeated enemies.
  26. Reward: Items or experience gained from completing quests.
  27. Experience: Points gained from completing tasks.
  28. Level: A measure of character progression.
  29. Stats: Core character attributes (strength, dexterity, etc.).
  30. Attributes: Properties of an entity.
  31. Modifiers: Changes to attributes or stats.
  32. Damage: A reduction in health.
  33. Healing: A restoration of health.
  34. Resistance: A reduction in damage taken.
  35. Vulnerability: An increase in damage taken.
  36. Collision: An event when two entities overlap.
  37. Hitbox: A region used for collision detection.
  38. Hurtbox: A region that can receive damage.
  39. Pathfinding: An algorithm for navigating through the world.
  40. AI (Artificial Intelligence): Systems that control non-player characters.
  41. Behavior: An AI’s actions and responses.
  42. Pattern: A predictable sequence of actions.
  43. Animation: A sequence of images or frames.
  44. State Machine: A system for managing animation and behavior states.
  45. Input: Player actions.
  46. Control: Player or AI control of an entity.
  47. Movement: Changes in an entity’s position.
  48. Navigation: The process of moving through the world.
  49. Tile: A unit of space in a grid-based world.
  50. Grid: A structured layout of tiles.
  51. Region: A large area within the world.
  52. Zone: A distinct area within a region.
  53. Room: A smaller enclosed area within a zone.
  54. Dungeon: A procedurally generated or hand-crafted area.
  55. Biome: A distinct ecological region.
  56. Terrain: The ground and environment.
  57. Weather: Environmental conditions.
  58. Lighting: The illumination of the scene.
  59. Shadow: An area of darkness.
  60. Camera: The viewpoint of the player.
  61. Viewport: The visible area of the screen.
  62. UI (User Interface): Elements for player interaction.
  63. HUD (Heads-Up Display): UI elements that overlay the game world.
  64. Menu: A UI element for navigating game options.
  65. Popup: A UI element that appears temporarily.
  66. Save: Storing game progress.
  67. Load: Restoring game progress.
  68. Resource: A global data structure.
  69. Asset: A game file (texture, model, sound, etc.).
  70. Pool: A collection of reusable objects.
  71. Factory: A system for creating objects.
  72. Manager: A system for managing game data.
  73. Event: A signal that something has happened.
  74. Message: A data structure used for communication.
  75. Packet: A data structure for network communication.
  76. Serialization: Converting data to a format for storage or transmission.
  77. Deserialization: Converting serialized data back to its original format.
  78. Randomizer: A system for generating random numbers.
  79. Seed: A value used to initialize a random number generator.
  80. Noise: A pattern of random values.
  81. Procedural Generation: Creating content algorithmically.
  82. Map: A representation of the world or a level.
  83. Graph: A data structure representing connections.
  84. Node: A point in a graph.
  85. Edge: A connection between nodes.
  86. State: A specific condition of an entity or system.
  87. Transition: A change from one state to another.
  88. Timer: A system for tracking time.
  89. Cooldown: A period of time before an action can be repeated.
  90. Waypoint: A point used for navigation.
  91. Checkpoint: A point where the player can save or respawn.
  92. Unlock: A progression mechanic.
  93. Upgrade: An improvement to an entity or item.
  94. Crafting: Combining items to create new items.
  95. Recipe: A formula for crafting.
  96. Faction: A group of entities with shared goals.
  97. Reputation: A measure of standing with a faction.
  98. Lore: The background story and history of the game world.
  99. Cutscene: A pre-rendered or scripted sequence.
  100. Particle System: A system for creating visual effects.
  101. Shader: A program that runs on the GPU.
  102. Render Target: A buffer that stores rendered images.
  103. Texture: An image used for rendering.
  104. Mesh: A 3D model.
  105. Skeleton: A structure used for animating 3D models.
  106. Physics Material: properties used for physics simulations.
  107. Sound Effect: a playable audio file.
  108. Music Track: a longer playable audio file.
  109. Localization: the process of adapting a game for different languages.
  110. Profile: a collection of user settings.

Game Development Terminology for Data Structures

Core Entity Components

  1. Entity - Base class/struct for any object in the game world
  2. Transform - Position, rotation, and scale data
  3. Sprite - Visual representation of an entity
  4. Collider - Hitbox for collision detection
  5. RigidBody - Physics properties for an entity
  6. Controller - Input handling component
  7. Stats - Character attributes like health, strength, etc.
  8. Inventory - Container for items
  9. WorldObject - Static element in the game world
  10. Actor - Any entity that can perform actions

Character Systems

  1. Character - Player or NPC with attributes
  2. PlayerCharacter - User-controlled entity
  3. NonPlayerCharacter - AI-controlled entity
  4. Mob - Mobile enemy entity
  5. Boss - Special powerful enemy
  6. Companion - Ally that follows the player
  7. Faction - Grouping for allegiance systems
  8. Class - Character archetype (Warrior, Mage, etc.)
  9. Race - Character species or type
  10. Profession - Character’s role or occupation

Combat Systems

  1. Weapon - Item used to deal damage
  2. Armor - Item used for defense
  3. Projectile - Moving object (arrows, bullets, etc.)
  4. Damage - Harm dealt to entities
  5. DamageType - Category of damage (Fire, Physical, etc.)
  6. StatusEffect - Temporary modification to an entity
  7. CombatManager - System controlling combat interactions
  8. Hitbox - Area that can receive damage
  9. Hurtbox - Area that can deal damage
  10. AttackPattern - Sequence of attack moves

Movement & Physics

  1. Velocity - Speed and direction
  2. Acceleration - Change in velocity
  3. Gravity - Downward force
  4. Jump - Upward movement mechanic
  5. Dash - Quick movement ability
  6. Teleport - Instantaneous movement
  7. PathNode - Point in a navigation path
  8. NavMesh - Navigation mesh for AI movement
  9. CollisionLayer - Group for collision filtering
  10. PhysicsMaterial - Properties affecting physics behavior

Progression Systems

  1. Level - Character progression stage
  2. Experience - Points toward level advancement
  3. Skill - Special ability or action
  4. SkillTree - Hierarchical skill organization
  5. Perk - Passive bonus
  6. Talent - Specialization option
  7. Attribute - Base character statistic
  8. ProgressionManager - System tracking advancement
  9. Milestone - Significant achievement point
  10. Quest - Objective-based mission

Items & Equipment

  1. Item - Collectible object
  2. Equipment - Wearable item
  3. Consumable - One-use item
  4. Rarity - Item quality level
  5. CraftingMaterial - Resource for item creation
  6. Recipe - Formula for crafting
  7. Modifier - Statistical change applied to items
  8. Enchantment - Magical property on equipment
  9. Currency - Medium of exchange
  10. Loot - Items dropped by enemies

World & Environment

  1. Room - Discrete area in the game
  2. Zone - Larger region containing rooms
  3. Biome - Environmental type with specific properties
  4. Portal - Connection between areas
  5. Hazard - Environmental danger
  6. Checkpoint - Save or respawn point
  7. Spawner - Entity generation point
  8. Trigger - Area causing an event when entered
  9. Destructible - Object that can be broken
  10. Weather - Environmental condition

Procedural Generation

  1. Generator - System creating content
  2. Seed - Value initializing random generation
  3. DungeonLayout - Structure of game level
  4. ProceduralRule - Constraint for generation
  5. TileSet - Collection of map pieces
  6. TerrainType - Category of landscape
  7. MapChunk - Section of a larger map
  8. NodeGraph - Connection structure for rooms
  9. GenerationParameter - Setting for procedural systems
  10. RoomTemplate - Pattern for room creation

Game State Management

  1. GameState - Current mode of play
  2. SaveData - Persistent game information
  3. Objective - Current goal
  4. SceneManager - System handling different game areas
  5. EventSystem - Manager for game events
  6. Flag - Boolean game state marker
  7. Condition - Requirement for an event
  8. Timeline - Sequence of game events
  9. DialogueTree - Conversation structure
  10. Cutscene - Non-interactive sequence

Abilities & Magic

  1. Ability - Special action with cooldown
  2. Spell - Magical effect
  3. Cooldown - Time until reuse
  4. Mana - Magic resource
  5. Aura - Area-based persistent effect
  6. ElementType - Magical affinity
  7. CastingTime - Duration to use ability
  8. AbilitySlot - Container for equipped ability
  9. Combo - Sequence of actions for special effect
  10. ResourcePool - Energy for using abilities

UI & Feedback

  1. HealthBar - Visual representation of health
  2. Minimap - Condensed map view
  3. Notification - Message to player
  4. HUD - Heads-up display elements
  5. MenuState - Current menu configuration
  6. Tooltip - Information popup
  7. InventorySlot - Position in inventory grid
  8. QuestMarker - Visual indicator for objectives
  9. DamageNumber - Floating combat text
  10. InteractionPrompt - UI for possible actions

Metroidvania Specifics

  1. Ability_Unlock - New player capability that enables progression
  2. MapCell - Individual section of the overall map
  3. SecretArea - Hidden location with rewards
  4. BacktrackTrigger - Event causing return to previous areas
  5. ProgressionBarrier - Obstacle requiring specific ability
  6. MapRevealComponent - System for uncovering the map
  7. AbilityGate - Obstacle requiring specific ability
  8. WorldConnectionNode - Link between map areas
  9. Shortcut - Unlockable path between areas
  10. DiscoveryTracker - Record of found secrets/areas

Roguelike Specifics

  1. Run - Single playthrough attempt
  2. MetaProgression - Advancement between runs
  3. Permadeath - Final character death mechanic
  4. FloorLevel - Depth in dungeon
  5. ItemPool - Collection of possible items
  6. RogueRandom - Random number generator
  7. Curse - Negative effect on character
  8. Blessing - Positive effect on character
  9. AscensionLevel - Difficulty tier
  10. RelicEffect - Permanent run modifier

ARPG Specifics

  1. StatScaling - Growth of attributes with level
  2. DamageFormula - Calculation for attack power
  3. LootTable - Probability distribution for drops
  4. AttributeRequirement - Stat needed to use item
  5. AreaOfEffect - Range of ability impact
  6. CriticalHit - Enhanced damage chance
  7. BuildData - Character specialization info
  8. GearSet - Related equipment pieces
  9. SocketSystem - Modification slots in equipment
  10. DifficultyTier - Challenge level setting

Below is a comprehensive list of 500 names that you might encounter as classes, structs, traits, or similar constructs in a typical game engine or game source code. This list is designed to support a versatile game engine capable of creating games across multiple genres, such as Action RPGs (ARPGs), Roguelikes, and Metroidvanias. The names cover core engine components, game-specific features, and utilities, providing you with a broad and recognizable vocabulary for developing new features.

The list is organized into categories for clarity, ensuring coverage of rendering, physics, audio, input, scripting, UI, networking, AI, and genre-specific functionalities, among others. Each name is unique and could plausibly appear in a game engine’s architecture.

Core Engine Components

  1. Engine - The main game engine class.
  2. Game - Represents the game instance.
  3. Application - Handles application lifecycle.
  4. MainLoop - Manages the game’s main loop.
  5. UpdateLoop - Controls game logic updates.
  6. RenderLoop - Manages rendering cycles.

Rendering

  1. Renderer - Base rendering system.
  2. Graphics - Graphics context manager.
  3. Window - Display window handler.
  4. Viewport - Defines the rendering area.
  5. FrameBuffer - Off-screen rendering target.
  6. RenderTarget - Destination for rendering output.
  7. Shader - Programmable graphics shader.
  8. VertexShader - Shader for vertex processing.
  9. FragmentShader - Shader for pixel processing.
  10. GeometryShader - Shader for geometry manipulation.
  11. ComputeShader - General-purpose compute shader.
  12. Material - Defines surface properties.
  13. Texture - Base texture class.
  14. Texture2D - 2D texture representation.
  15. Texture3D - 3D volumetric texture.
  16. CubeMap - Environment mapping texture.
  17. RenderTexture - Texture for render-to-texture.
  18. Mesh - 3D geometry data.
  19. Model - Complete 3D object with mesh and material.
  20. Vertex - Single point in a mesh.
  21. IndexBuffer - Indices for mesh rendering.
  22. VertexBuffer - Vertex data storage.
  23. Geometry - Abstract geometry representation.
  24. Primitive - Basic renderable shape.
  25. Line - Line geometry.
  26. Triangle - Triangle geometry.
  27. Quad - Quadrilateral geometry.
  28. Polygon - General polygon geometry.
  29. Camera - Base camera class.
  30. PerspectiveCamera - Camera with perspective projection.
  31. OrthographicCamera - Camera with orthographic projection.
  32. Light - Base lighting class.
  33. PointLight - Omnidirectional light source.
  34. DirectionalLight - Sun-like light source.
  35. SpotLight - Focused light source.
  36. AmbientLight - Uniform background lighting.
  37. Skybox - Background environment renderable.
  38. PostProcessing - Post-render effects manager.
  39. Bloom - Glow effect for bright areas.
  40. DepthOfField - Focus blur effect.
  41. MotionBlur - Blur for fast-moving objects.
  42. ScreenSpaceReflection - Real-time reflections.
  43. VolumetricLight - Light scattering effect.
  44. ParticleSystem - Manages particle effects.
  45. ParticleEmitter - Spawns particles.
  46. Particle - Individual particle instance.
  47. Sprite - 2D renderable image.
  48. SpriteSheet - Collection of sprites.
  49. Animation - Base animation class.
  50. Animator - Controls animation playback.
  51. Skeleton - Bone structure for animation.
  52. Bone - Single bone in a skeleton.
  53. Skin - Mesh deformation data.
  54. MorphTarget - Shape key for morph animations.

Physics

  1. PhysicsEngine - Core physics simulation.
  2. PhysicsWorld - Physics simulation environment.
  3. RigidBody - Physics object with mass.
  4. Collider - Base collision shape.
  5. BoxCollider - Rectangular collision volume.
  6. SphereCollider - Spherical collision volume.
  7. CapsuleCollider - Capsule-shaped collision volume.
  8. MeshCollider - Mesh-based collision shape.
  9. Trigger - Non-physical collision detector.
  10. Constraint - Limits object movement.
  11. Joint - Base joint for constraints.
  12. HingeJoint - Rotational joint.
  13. BallSocketJoint - Spherical joint.
  14. FixedJoint - Rigid connection.
  15. Spring - Elastic constraint.
  16. Force - Applied physics force.
  17. Gravity - Gravitational force simulator.
  18. Friction - Surface friction handler.
  19. Restitution - Bounce coefficient manager.
  20. CollisionDetection - Detects object intersections.
  21. BroadPhase - Initial collision filtering.
  22. NarrowPhase - Precise collision detection.
  23. Contact - Collision contact point.
  24. Manifold - Collision contact details.
  25. Raycast - Ray intersection test.
  26. SweepTest - Continuous collision test.
  27. FluidSimulation - Liquid physics system.
  28. ClothSimulation - Fabric physics system.
  29. DestructionSystem - Breakable object manager.

Audio

  1. AudioManager - Manages audio playback.
  2. Sound - Base audio class.
  3. Music - Background music handler.
  4. AudioSource - Audio emission point.
  5. AudioListener - Audio reception point.
  6. AudioClip - Audio data container.
  7. SoundEffect - Short audio effect.
  8. AmbientSound - Background environmental sound.
  9. PositionalSound - 3D-positioned sound.
  10. GlobalSound - Non-spatial sound.
  11. LoopingSound - Continuously repeating sound.
  12. Reverb - Echo effect.
  13. Echo - Delayed sound repetition.
  14. Distortion - Audio distortion effect.
  15. SpatialAudio - 3D audio system.
  16. HRTF - Head-related transfer function for 3D audio.
  17. BinauralAudio - Stereo 3D audio simulation.

Input

  1. InputManager - Handles all input devices.
  2. Keyboard - Keyboard input handler.
  3. Mouse - Mouse input handler.
  4. Controller - Gamepad input handler.
  5. Joystick - Analog stick input.
  6. TouchInput - Touchscreen input.
  7. GestureRecognizer - Detects touch gestures.
  8. VRController - Virtual reality controller input.
  9. Key - Single key input.
  10. Button - Generic button input.
  11. Axis - Analog input axis.
  12. InputAction - Mapped input event.
  13. InputBinding - Custom input mapping.

Scripting

  1. Script - Base script class.
  2. Behavior - Scripted entity behavior.
  3. Component - Modular script component.
  4. ScriptEngine - Executes scripts.
  5. LuaScript - Lua-based script.
  6. PythonScript - Python-based script.
  7. Function - Scripted function.
  8. Variable - Script variable.
  9. Event - Script-triggered event.
  10. Delegate - Function pointer for scripting.

Entity-Component-System (ECS)

  1. Entity - Basic game object.
  2. GameObject - Entity with components.
  3. Transform - Position, rotation, scale data.
  4. Component - Modular entity feature.
  5. System - Processes components.
  6. EntityManager - Manages entities.
  7. ComponentManager - Manages component types.
  8. SystemManager - Coordinates systems.

Scene Management

  1. Scene - Game level or state.
  2. SceneGraph - Hierarchical scene structure.
  3. SceneNode - Node in the scene graph.
  4. Layer - Rendering or logic layer.
  5. Tag - Entity identifier.
  6. Hierarchy - Parent-child relationships.

Resource Management

  1. ResourceManager - Loads and manages assets.
  2. AssetLoader - Loads specific asset types.
  3. Cache - Stores loaded resources.
  4. Resource - Base resource class.
  5. Asset - Game asset (e.g., texture, model).
  6. Bundle - Grouped assets.
  7. Prefab - Preconfigured entity template.
  8. Template - Reusable object blueprint.

Event System

  1. EventManager - Manages event dispatching.
  2. Event - Base event class.
  3. Listener - Event receiver.
  4. Subscriber - Event subscription handler.
  5. EventQueue - Queues events for processing.
  6. EventDispatcher - Sends events to listeners.
  7. CollisionEvent - Collision occurrence event.
  8. InputEvent - User input event.
  9. NetworkEvent - Multiplayer-related event.

User Interface

  1. UIManager - Manages UI elements.
  2. HUD - Heads-up display.
  3. Menu - Menu screen.
  4. Button - Clickable UI element.
  5. Text - Text display element.
  6. Image - UI image element.
  7. Slider - Adjustable value control.
  8. Checkbox - Toggleable option.
  9. Dropdown - Selection menu.
  10. ScrollView - Scrollable content area.
  11. Panel - UI container.
  12. Layout - UI element arrangement.
  13. Widget - Generic UI component.
  14. Canvas - UI rendering surface.

Networking

  1. NetworkManager - Manages network connections.
  2. Server - Hosts multiplayer sessions.
  3. Client - Connects to servers.
  4. Packet - Network data unit.
  5. Protocol - Communication rules.
  6. Connection - Network link.
  7. Socket - Network endpoint.
  8. TCPConnection - Reliable network connection.
  9. UDPConnection - Fast, unreliable connection.
  10. WebSocketConnection - Web-based connection.
  11. Matchmaking - Player pairing system.
  12. Lobby - Pre-game gathering area.
  13. VoiceChat - Real-time voice communication.

Artificial Intelligence

  1. AIController - Manages AI behavior.
  2. Pathfinding - Navigation system.
  3. StateMachine - Finite state machine for AI.
  4. BehaviorTree - Hierarchical AI behavior.
  5. Agent - AI-controlled entity.
  6. Brain - AI decision-making core.
  7. Decision - AI choice logic.
  8. PatrolState - AI patrol behavior.
  9. ChaseState - AI pursuit behavior.
  10. FleeState - AI escape behavior.
  11. NavigationMesh - Pathfinding grid.
  12. Waypoint - Navigation marker.

Animation

  1. Animation - Base animation class.
  2. Animator - Controls animation playback.
  3. AnimationClip - Single animation sequence.
  4. AnimationState - Current animation status.
  5. AnimationCurve - Animation timing curve.
  6. Skeleton - Bone structure.
  7. Bone - Single skeletal element.
  8. Skin - Mesh deformation data.
  9. MorphTarget - Shape key animation.
  10. Keyframe - Animation frame marker.
  11. BlendTree - Animation blending system.
  12. InverseKinematics - Realistic limb positioning.

Particle Systems

  1. ParticleSystem - Manages particle effects.
  2. ParticleEmitter - Spawns particles.
  3. Particle - Single particle instance.
  4. Affector - Modifies particle behavior.
  5. PointEmitter - Single-point particle source.
  6. LineEmitter - Linear particle source.
  7. VolumeEmitter - 3D volume particle source.
  8. GPUParticle - GPU-accelerated particle.

Save and Load

  1. SaveManager - Handles game saving.
  2. LoadManager - Handles game loading.
  3. Serializer - Converts data to storage format.
  4. Deserializer - Restores data from storage.
  5. JSONSerializer - JSON-based serialization.
  6. XMLSerializer - XML-based serialization.
  7. BinarySerializer - Binary data serialization.
  8. CloudSave - Online save storage.
  9. Encryption - Data security for saves.

Utility Classes

  1. Vector - Base vector class.
  2. Vector2 - 2D vector.
  3. Vector3 - 3D vector.
  4. Vector4 - 4D vector.
  5. Matrix - Base matrix class.
  6. Matrix3x3 - 3x3 matrix.
  7. Matrix4x4 - 4x4 matrix.
  8. Quaternion - Rotation representation.
  9. Color - Color data.
  10. Rect - Rectangle structure.
  11. AABB - Axis-aligned bounding box.
  12. Sphere - Spherical bounds.
  13. Plane - Flat surface.
  14. Line - Straight line.
  15. Ray - Directed line segment.
  16. Math - Mathematical utilities.
  17. Random - Random number generator.
  18. Noise - Noise generation base.
  19. PerlinNoise - Smooth noise function.
  20. SimplexNoise - Optimized noise function.
  21. Time - Time management.
  22. Timer - Countdown or interval timer.
  23. Clock - Real-time clock.
  24. Stopwatch - Performance timing.

Game-Specific Features

  1. Character - Base character class.
  2. Player - Player-controlled character.
  3. NPC - Non-player character.
  4. Enemy - Hostile character.
  5. Stats - Character attributes.
  6. Health - Hit points tracker.
  7. Mana - Magic resource tracker.
  8. Experience - Progression points.
  9. Level - Character or game progression stage.
  10. Skill - Character ability.
  11. Ability - Special power or move.
  12. Talent - Passive character trait.
  13. Inventory - Item storage.
  14. Item - Base item class.
  15. Weapon - Combat item.
  16. Armor - Protective item.
  17. Consumable - Usable item.
  18. Potion - Healing consumable.
  19. Scroll - Magic consumable.
  20. Amulet - Equippable accessory.
  21. Quest - Story or task objective.
  22. Dialogue - Conversation system.
  23. Choice - Dialogue option.
  24. CraftingRecipe - Item creation formula.
  25. Ingredient - Crafting component.
  26. CraftingStation - Crafting location.
  27. ProceduralGenerator - Dynamic content creator.
  28. DungeonGenerator - Dungeon layout creator.
  29. TerrainGenerator - Landscape creator.
  30. RoomGenerator - Room layout creator.
  31. CorridorGenerator - Passage creator.
  32. LootGenerator - Item drop creator.
  33. Map - Game world overview.
  34. Tile - Map grid unit.
  35. TileMap - Grid-based map.
  36. Room - Enclosed map area.
  37. Door - Map transition point.
  38. Checkpoint - Save or respawn point.
  39. Gate - Progression barrier.
  40. TurnManager - Turn-based system.
  41. Action - Turn-based move.
  42. Command - Player or AI instruction.
  43. Permadeath - Permanent death system.
  44. TurnBasedCombat - Combat turn manager.
  45. Backtracking - Exploration mechanic.
  46. AbilityGating - Progression lock system.

Debugging and Profiling

  1. Debug - Debugging utilities.
  2. Profiler - Performance monitor.
  3. Logger - Event logger.
  4. Console - In-game command console.
  5. DebugDraw - Visual debugging tool.
  6. Log - Single log entry.
  7. Assertion - Runtime check.

Platform-Specific

  1. Platform - Base platform class.
  2. Device - Hardware abstraction.
  3. WindowsPlatform - Windows-specific code.
  4. MacPlatform - macOS-specific code.
  5. LinuxPlatform - Linux-specific code.
  6. AndroidPlatform - Android-specific code.
  7. iOSPlatform - iOS-specific code.
  8. ConsolePlatform - Console-specific code.
  9. WebPlatform - Web-based platform code.

Editor Tools

  1. Editor - Game editor interface.
  2. SceneEditor - Scene design tool.
  3. AssetBrowser - Asset management tool.
  4. Inspector - Property viewer/editor.
  5. PropertyEditor - Specific property editor.
  6. Tool - Generic editor tool.
  7. Brush - Terrain or object placement tool.
  8. Gizmo - Transform manipulation tool.

Version Control

  1. VersionControl - Versioning system.
  2. GitIntegration - Git support.
  3. SVNIntegration - SVN support.
  4. PerforceIntegration - Perforce support.

Licensing and Attribution

  1. LicenseManager - License validation.
  2. CreditsScreen - Attribution display.
  3. Attribution - Credit entry.

Analytics and Telemetry

  1. AnalyticsManager - Tracks game data.
  2. EventTracker - Logs specific events.
  3. MetricsCollector - Gathers performance metrics.
  4. Telemetry - Remote data reporting.

Monetization

  1. InAppPurchase - In-game purchases.
  2. AdManager - Advertisement system.
  3. SubscriptionService - Recurring payment system.
  4. Microtransaction - Small purchase handler.

Social Features

  1. SocialManager - Social integration.
  2. Leaderboard - Player rankings.
  3. AchievementSystem - Achievement tracker.
  4. Friend - Social connection.
  5. Message - Player communication.
  6. Notification - In-game alert.

Security

  1. AntiCheat - Cheat prevention system.
  2. Encryption - Data security.
  3. Decryption - Data recovery.
  4. Hash - Data integrity check.
  5. Authentication - User verification.

Cloud Services

  1. CloudSave - Online save storage.
  2. CloudStorage - General cloud storage.
  3. RemoteConfig - Dynamic configuration.
  4. API - Cloud service interface.
  5. Endpoint - API connection point.

Virtual Reality / Augmented Reality

  1. VRManager - VR system manager.
  2. ARSession - AR session handler.
  3. TrackingSystem - Position tracking.
  4. Headset - VR/AR device.
  5. Controller - VR/AR input device.
  6. Tracker - Motion tracker.

Haptics

  1. HapticManager - Feedback manager.
  2. VibrationController - Vibration effects.
  3. ForceFeedback - Advanced haptic response.
  4. Rumble - Controller rumble effect.

Accessibility

  1. AccessibilityOptions - Accessibility settings.
  2. ScreenReader - Text-to-speech system.
  3. ColorBlindMode - Color adjustment.
  4. FontSize - Text scaling.
  5. Contrast - Visual contrast settings.
  6. AudioDescription - Narration for visuals.
  7. RemappableControls - Custom input mapping.
  8. Subtitles - Text for audio.

Internationalization

  1. LocalizationManager - Language manager.
  2. Language - Language settings.
  3. Translation - Text translation.
  4. Locale - Regional settings.
  5. Format - Data formatting.
  6. DateTimeFormat - Time/date display.
  7. CurrencyFormat - Money display.

Design Patterns

  1. Singleton - Single-instance class.
  2. Observer - Event listener pattern.
  3. Factory - Object creation pattern.
  4. Strategy - Interchangeable behavior.
  5. Command - Encapsulated action.
  6. State - State management pattern.
  7. Visitor - Operation on object structure.

General Managers and Systems

  1. GameManager - Oversees game state.
  2. SceneManager - Manages scene transitions.
  3. AudioManager - Controls audio.
  4. InputManager - Handles input.
  5. NetworkManager - Manages networking.
  6. UIManager - Manages UI.
  7. PhysicsManager - Oversees physics.
  8. AnimationManager - Controls animations.
  9. ParticleManager - Manages particles.
  10. ResourceManager - Handles assets.
  11. EventManager - Manages events.
  12. ScriptManager - Manages scripts.
  13. AIManager - Oversees AI.
  14. SaveManager - Handles saving.
  15. LoadManager - Handles loading.
  16. DebugManager - Manages debugging.
  17. ProfileManager - Manages profiling.
  18. SettingsManager - Manages game settings.

Interfaces and Abstract Classes

  1. IRenderable - Renderable object interface.
  2. ICollidable - Collidable object interface.
  3. IAudible - Audible object interface.
  4. IUpdatable - Updatable object interface.
  5. IDrawable - Drawable object interface.
  6. IClickable - Clickable object interface.
  7. IMovable - Movable object interface.
  8. IInteractable - Interactive object interface.
  9. ISerializable - Serializable object interface.
  10. ICloneable - Cloneable object interface.
  11. IComparable - Comparable object interface.

Data Structures

  1. Array - Basic array structure.
  2. List - Dynamic list structure.
  3. Map - Key-value mapping.
  4. Set - Unique element collection.
  5. Queue - FIFO structure.
  6. Stack - LIFO structure.
  7. Tree - Hierarchical structure.
  8. Graph - Node-edge structure.
  9. EntityList - List of entities.
  10. ComponentMap - Component type mapping.
  11. EventQueue - Queued events.

Mathematical Concepts

  1. Point - 2D/3D point.
  2. Vector2D - 2D vector.
  3. Vector3D - 3D vector.
  4. Matrix2x2 - 2x2 matrix.
  5. Matrix3x3 - 3x3 matrix.
  6. Matrix4x4 - 4x4 matrix.
  7. Quaternion - Rotation data.
  8. EulerAngles - Angle-based rotation.
  9. Transform - Position/rotation/scale.
  10. Rotation - Rotation component.
  11. Scale - Scaling component.
  12. Translation - Position component.
  13. Projection - Camera projection.
  14. Frustum - Viewable volume.
  15. ViewVolume - Visible area.

Time and Timing

  1. DeltaTime - Time between frames.
  2. FrameRate - Frames per second.
  3. TimeScale - Game speed multiplier.
  4. FixedTimestep - Fixed update interval.
  5. VariableTimestep - Dynamic update interval.

Randomness

  1. RandomGenerator - Random number source.
  2. Seed - Random seed value.
  3. Distribution - Random distribution base.
  4. UniformDistribution - Even random spread.
  5. NormalDistribution - Bell-curve random spread.
  6. PoissonDistribution - Event frequency spread.

Color and Imaging

  1. ColorRGB - RGB color model.
  2. ColorRGBA - RGBA color model.
  3. ColorHSV - HSV color model.
  4. ColorHSL - HSL color model.
  5. Palette - Color collection.
  6. Gradient - Color transition.
  7. Image - Base image class.
  8. Pixel - Single image pixel.
  9. Bitmap - Raster image.
  10. VectorImage - Scalable image.

Text and Fonts

  1. Font - Text typeface.
  2. Glyph - Single character shape.
  3. TextRenderer - Renders text.
  4. String - Text data.
  5. LocalizationString - Translated text.

Geometry

  1. Circle - Circular shape.
  2. Ellipse - Oval shape.
  3. Rectangle - Rectangular shape.
  4. Polygon - Multi-sided shape.
  5. Polyline - Connected line segments.
  6. BezierCurve - Smooth curve.
  7. Spline - Interpolated curve.

Optimization

  1. OcclusionCulling - Hides unseen objects.
  2. FrustumCulling - Removes out-of-view objects.
  3. LevelOfDetail - Detail level manager.
  4. BatchRendering - Groups render calls.
  5. Instancing - Efficient object rendering.
  6. GPUInstancing - GPU-based instancing.
  7. CPUInstancing - CPU-based instancing.

Testing and QA

  1. TestFramework - Testing system.
  2. MockObject - Simulated object for tests.
  3. Stub - Placeholder functionality.
  4. Spy - Monitors interactions.
  5. TestCase - Single test scenario.
  6. TestSuite - Group of tests.

Versioning

  1. VersionNumber - Software version.
  2. BuildNumber - Build identifier.
  3. Revision - Version revision.
  4. Branch - Development branch.
  5. Tag - Version marker.

Licensing

  1. LicenseKey - Activation key.
  2. Validation - License check.

Additional Game Mechanics

  1. StatusEffect - Temporary character condition.
  2. DialogueNode - Conversation tree node.
  3. Objective - Quest goal.
  4. Reward - Quest completion prize.
  5. Equipment - Equippable item slot.
  6. Path - Movement route.
  7. Navigator - Pathfinding guide.

(Due to technical issues, the search service is temporarily unavailable.)

Here’s a comprehensive list of over 500 game engine class/struct/trait names, organized by category for clarity. These cover core systems, rendering, physics, gameplay, and genre-specific features (ARPG, Roguelike, Metroidvania):

  2. GameInstance

  21. Localization
